abstract: Parent coordinators, who work as liaisons between at New York City public schools and students' families, prepare for first day classes; loosely defined position was created during administration of Mayor Michael Bloomberg and now every public elementary and middle school, as well as some high schools, has one.

headline.print_headline: Meeting Parents’ Demands and Schools’ Needs, Whatever They May Be
headline.main: The Title: Parent Coordinator. The Job: Whatever Needs to Be Done.

snippet: From checking for lice to reassuring anxious families, the roles of parent coordinators are as varied as the New York City public schools they serve....
lead_paragraph: From checking for lice to reassuring anxious families, the roles of parent coordinators are as varied as the New York City public schools they serve.
